title: How to Send Software Through Gmail in 7 Steps

steps.title: Sign in to https://drive.google.com.
steps.content: Sign in to https://drive.google.com . Log in with the same Google account you use to sign in to Gmail. As a Gmail user, you have 15 GB of free space in your Google Drive by default. [1] X Research source If you need more space, you can upgrade to Google One.

steps.title: Drag the program file you want to share into your browser window.
steps.content: Drag the program file you want to share into your browser window. You can also click the +New button and select File upload to browse for the file on your computer. Make sure you are uploading the installer or setup file for the program you are sharing. If the program runs without installing but requires multiple files, consider creating a ZIP archive containing all of the necessary files so you only have to upload a single file.

steps.title: Wait for the file to upload.
steps.content: Wait for the file to upload. This may take a while for larger files. You can monitor the progress at the bottom of the window. When the file is finished uploading, you will see "1 upload complete" at the bottom-right corner of the page.

steps.title: Right-click the uploaded file and select Share.
steps.content: Right-click the uploaded file and select Share . This opens the "Share with people and groups" window.

steps.title: Enter the email address of the person you want to share with.
steps.content: Enter the email address of the person you want to share with. When you share a message directly from your Google Drive, it will use your Gmail address to send the file. You can send the message to multiple people if you'd like—just enter each email address into the box. After you enter at least one email address, a new field will expand that allows you to compose a message. The "Notify people" box will be checked—make sure not to remove the checkmark.

steps.title: Type your message into the box.
steps.content: Type your message into the box. Anything you would've typed directly into the Gmail message can go into this box.

steps.title: Click Send to send the message.
steps.content: Click Send to send the message. This sends an email message to the recipient(s) with a link to the file. When the recipient receives the message, they can click the link to open it in their web browser. Then, they'll need to click the download button in the upper-right corner (it looks like a downward-pointing arrow over a bracket) to save the EXE to their computer.
